name: Havfrue/AEC-2
description: Transatlantic system with a Norway branch landing near Kristiansand.
abstract: Major transatlantic submarine cable connecting Norway to North America via Denmark and Ireland, owned by a consortium including Meta, Google, Aqua Comms and Bulk Infrastructure.
summary: Havfrue/AEC-2 is a 7,650 km submarine cable system that entered service in November 2020. The Norway branch lands near Kristiansand, connecting to the main transatlantic route via Blaabjerg (Denmark) and Killala Bay (Ireland) to Wall Township, New Jersey. The system is operated by Bulk Infrastructure and provides critical international connectivity for Norwegian data traffic.

name: NO-UK Cable System
description: Open cable system connecting Stavanger (NO) and Newcastle area (UK).
abstract: Open-access submarine cable connecting Norway and the UK, providing direct connectivity between Stavanger and the Seaton Sluice area near Newcastle.

name: IOEMA
description: Planned North Sea system: trunk Dumpton Gap (UK) to Kristiansand (NO) with branches to NL/DE/DK.
abstract: Planned multi-branch North Sea submarine cable system connecting the UK, Norway, Netherlands, Germany, and Denmark.

name: Celtic Norse
description: Planned Norway to Ireland system landing at Oysanden (south of Trondheim).
abstract: Planned submarine cable connecting Norway and Ireland, providing an alternative transatlantic route via the Irish hub.

name: Arctic Way
description: Planned system connecting mainland Norway to Jan Mayen and Svalbard.
abstract: The world's northernmost planned subsea cable system, connecting mainland Norway to Jan Mayen and Svalbard for enhanced Arctic connectivity.
summary: Arctic Way is a planned 2,350 km submarine cable system expected to be ready for service in Q2 2028. Owned and operated by Space Norway, it will provide critical communications infrastructure for Norway's Arctic territories, connecting Bodo on the mainland to Jan Mayen and Hotellneset (Svalbard).

name: Leif Erikson (planned)
description: Planned transatlantic system promoted by Bulk Infrastructure (public details still evolving).
abstract: Planned transatlantic submarine cable promoted by Bulk Infrastructure, expected to provide additional Norway-US connectivity.

name: HAVSIL
description: Repeaterless subsea cable between Bulk's N01 (Kristiansand) and DK01 (Esbjerg).
abstract: Short-haul repeaterless submarine cable connecting Bulk Infrastructure's datacenters in Norway and Denmark.

name: Skagen Fiber West (Larvik-Hirtshals)
description: Repeaterless subsea cable connecting Larvik (NO) and Hirtshals (DK). Schematic representation.
abstract: Submarine cable connecting Larvik, Norway to Hirtshals, Denmark, providing direct Norway-Denmark connectivity.

name: NORFEST (Nordic Festoon)
description: Coastal festoon system with multiple landings along the Norwegian coast; provides route diversity from terrestrial backbone.
abstract: Coastal submarine cable system providing route diversity along the Norwegian coast from Egersund to Oslo.
summary: NORFEST (Nordic Festoon) is a 749 km coastal submarine cable system operated by Tampnet that became operational in 2023. It provides critical route diversity for Norwegian communications by offering an alternative to terrestrial backbone networks, with landings at Egersund, Stavanger, Kristiansand, Arendal, Larvik, Moss, Drobak, and Oslo.

name: N0r5ke Viking
description: 810 km subsea cable between Bergen and Trondheim; includes a crosslink between Molde and Andalsnes.
abstract: Domestic submarine cable connecting Bergen and Trondheim along the Norwegian coast, part of the N0r5ke dark fiber ring project.

name: N0r5ke Phase 2: Bergen-Oslo subsea (planned)
description: Phase 2 (planned): ~950 km subsea cable between Bergen and Oslo as part of a ~2,500 km dark fiber ring project (schematic).
abstract: Planned submarine cable segment between Bergen and Oslo, part of the N0r5ke dark fiber ring expansion.

name: N0r5ke Phase 2: Oslo-Trondheim terrestrial (planned)
description: Phase 2 (planned): ~700 km terrestrial fiber between Oslo and Trondheim as part of a ~2,500 km dark fiber ring project (schematic).
abstract: Planned terrestrial fiber segment between Oslo and Trondheim, completing the N0r5ke dark fiber ring.

name: N0r5ke Viking (Molde-Andalsnes crosslink)
description: Crosslink segment referenced for N0r5ke Viking (schematic).
abstract: Short crosslink segment connecting Molde and Andalsnes as part of the N0r5ke Viking system.

name: Svalbard Undersea Cable System
description: Twin submarine communications cables connecting mainland Norway to Svalbard (schematic route).
abstract: Critical submarine cable infrastructure providing communications connectivity between mainland Norway and Svalbard.
summary: The Svalbard Undersea Cable System consists of twin submarine communications cables that have been operational since 2004. Owned and operated by Space Norway, the system connects Harstad and Breivika (Tromso) on the mainland to Hotellneset on Svalbard, providing essential communications for Norway's Arctic archipelago.

name: Longyearbyen-Ny-Alesund
description: Local Svalbard connectivity for research/community needs (schematic).
abstract: Local terrestrial fiber connection on Svalbard between Longyearbyen and Ny-Alesund research station.

name: Inter-City Ring
description: Major south Norway backbone ring (schematic endpoints only; exact terrestrial routing is not public).
abstract: Major terrestrial fiber backbone ring connecting Norway's largest southern cities operated by Bulk Infrastructure.

name: Tampnet Offshore Network (North)
description: Offshore communications network (schematic; detailed routes are not public).
abstract: Offshore submarine communications network serving oil and gas platforms in the northern Norwegian continental shelf.

name: Tampnet Offshore Network (South)
description: Offshore communications network (schematic; detailed routes are not public).
abstract: Offshore submarine communications network serving oil and gas platforms in the southern Norwegian continental shelf.

name: Terrestrial fiber corridor (Oslo-Stockholm)
description: Schematic representation of Norway-Sweden terrestrial cross-border fiber connectivity via major road/rail corridors. Exact routes/capacities are typically not public.
abstract: Cross-border terrestrial fiber connectivity between Oslo and Stockholm via Sweden.

name: Terrestrial fiber corridor (Oslo-Gothenburg)
description: Schematic representation of Norway-Sweden terrestrial cross-border fiber connectivity (Oslo-Gothenburg corridor).
abstract: Cross-border terrestrial fiber connectivity between Oslo and Gothenburg via Sweden.

name: Terrestrial fiber corridor (Bodo-Lulea)
description: Schematic representation of North Norway cross-border terrestrial connectivity via Sweden. Exact routes/capacities are typically not public.
abstract: Cross-border terrestrial fiber connectivity between northern Norway and Sweden.

name: Terrestrial fiber corridor (Bodo-Oulu)
description: Schematic representation of North Norway cross-border terrestrial connectivity via Finland/Sweden corridors. Exact routes/capacities are typically not public.
abstract: Cross-border terrestrial fiber connectivity between northern Norway and Finland.

name: Satellite backup connectivity (Norway)
description: Satellite communications provide resilience/backup connectivity, especially for remote areas. This entry is non-geometric (not drawn as a line).
abstract: Satellite communications infrastructure providing backup connectivity for Norway, especially remote and Arctic areas.
